meanings.definition: To hesitate or be unwilling to accept an idea or suggestion.
meanings.sent1: She always baulks at trying new foods.
meanings.sent2: He baulks at the idea of public speaking.
meanings.sent3: The cat baulks at wearing a tiny hat.
meanings.sent4: The student baulks at the thought of taking a pop quiz.
meanings.sent5: The dog baulks at crossing the narrow bridge.

meanings.definition: A beam or timber used in building.
meanings.sent1: The carpenter carried the heavy baulks to the construction site.
meanings.sent2: The old barn was supported by sturdy baulks.
meanings.sent3: The baulks lined up neatly in the lumberyard.
meanings.sent4: The baulks formed the foundation of the new house.
meanings.sent5: The baulks creaked under the weight of the roof.

meanings.definition: A strip of land left unplowed in a field.
meanings.sent1: The farmer left baulks of land for the wildlife to roam.
meanings.sent2: The baulks of grass grew wild in the meadow.
meanings.sent3: The baulks of earth created a natural barrier.
meanings.sent4: The baulks of soil were untouched by the plow.
meanings.sent5: The baulks of field provided a safe haven for small animals.
